thread.title: Le'Veon Bell injures left groin in AFC championship
thread.title_full: Le'Veon Bell injures left groin in AFC championship

author: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Le'Veon Bell injures left groin in AFC championship
text:
Le'Veon Bell injures left groin in AFC championship January 22, 2017 7:30 PM Jim Rogash / Getty Images Steelers running back Le'Veon Bell extends his hand for a high five before the AFC championship game against the New England Patriots. Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
Steelers running back Le’Veon Bell sustained a groin injury during the second quarter of the AFC championship against the New England Patriots. #Steelers RB Le'Veon Bell sustained a left groin injury. His return to today's game is questionable. — Burt Lauten (@SteelersPRBurt) January 23, 2017 
He returned for one player later in the quarter but quickly returned to the sidelines. Bell slow jog to the sideline. Didn't look right at all. DeAngelo in the game. — Jason Mackey (@JMackeyPG) January 23, 2017 Related Media:
